description: A square temple located c. 200 yards north west of Lancing Ring. Martyn et al suggest that the temple is very likely late Iron Age in date but was probably out of use by the late 3rd CE or early 4th CE.
bibliography: Frere, Sheppard. Sussex Archaeological Collections 81 (1940): 145 ff.
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Money Mound, Hammerpond Road (West Sussex).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
Rudling, David. “Roman-Period Temples, Shrines and Religion in Sussex.” In Ritual Landscapes of Roman South-East Britain, edited by David Rudling, 2008.
Smith, C. R. Collectanea Antiqua 1 (1848): 92 ff.
